connector.description: Exchange information in the healthcare domain using the FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) standard.

camel.sink.path.apiName.name: camel.sink.path.apiName
camel.sink.path.apiName.description: What kind of operation to perform One of: [CAPABILITIES] [CREATE] [DELETE] [HISTORY] [LOAD_PAGE] [META] [OPERATION] [PATCH] [READ] [SEARCH] [TRANSACTION] [UPDATE] [VALIDATE]

camel.sink.path.methodName.name: camel.sink.path.methodName
camel.sink.path.methodName.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encoding
camel.sink.endpoint.encoding.description: Encoding to use for all request One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.sink.endpoint.fhirVersion.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fhirVersion
camel.sink.endpoint.fhirVersion.description: The FHIR Version to use One of: [DSTU2] [DSTU2_HL7ORG] [DSTU2_1] [DSTU3] [R4] [R5]

camel.sink.endpoint.inBody.name: camel.sink.endpoint.inBody
camel.sink.endpoint.inBody.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

camel.sink.endpoint.log.name: camel.sink.endpoint.log
camel.sink.endpoint.log.description: Will log every requests and responses

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.clientFactory.description: To use the custom client factory

camel.sink.endpoint.compress.name: camel.sink.endpoint.compress
camel.sink.endpoint.compress.description: Compresses outgoing (POST/PUT) contents to the GZIP format

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: How long to try and establish the initial TCP connection (in ms)

camel.sink.endpoint.deferModelScanning.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deferModelScanning
camel.sink.endpoint.deferModelScanning.description: When this option is set, model classes will not be scanned for children until the child list for the given type is actually accessed.

camel.sink.endpoint.fhirContext.name: camel.sink.endpoint.fhirContext
camel.sink.endpoint.fhirContext.description: FhirContext is an expensive object to create. To avoid creating multiple instances, it can be set directly.

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionCookie.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionCookie
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionCookie.description: HTTP session cookie to add to every request

camel.sink.endpoint.socketTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.socketTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.socketTimeout.description: How long to block for individual read/write operations (in ms)

camel.sink.endpoint.summary.name: camel.sink.endpoint.summary
camel.sink.endpoint.summary.description: Request that the server modify the response using the _summary param One of: [COUNT] [TEXT] [DATA] [TRUE] [FALSE]

camel.sink.endpoint.validationMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.validationMode
camel.sink.endpoint.validationMode.description: When should Camel validate the FHIR Server's conformance statement One of: [NEVER] [ONCE]

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: Username to use for basic authentication

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: Username to use for basic authentication

camel.component.fhir.encoding.name: camel.component.fhir.encoding
camel.component.fhir.encoding.description: Encoding to use for all request One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion.name: camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion
camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion.description: The FHIR Version to use One of: [DSTU2] [DSTU2_HL7ORG] [DSTU2_1] [DSTU3] [R4] [R5]

camel.component.fhir.log.name: camel.component.fhir.log
camel.component.fhir.log.description: Will log every requests and responses

camel.component.fhir.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.fhir.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.fhir.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.fhir.clientFactory.name: camel.component.fhir.clientFactory
camel.component.fhir.clientFactory.description: To use the custom client factory

camel.component.fhir.compress.name: camel.component.fhir.compress
camel.component.fhir.compress.description: Compresses outgoing (POST/PUT) contents to the GZIP format

camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout.name: camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout
camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout.description: How long to try and establish the initial TCP connection (in ms)

camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning.name: camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning
camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning.description: When this option is set, model classes will not be scanned for children until the child list for the given type is actually accessed.

camel.component.fhir.fhirContext.name: camel.component.fhir.fhirContext
camel.component.fhir.fhirContext.description: FhirContext is an expensive object to create. To avoid creating multiple instances, it can be set directly.

camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie.name: camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie
camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie.description: HTTP session cookie to add to every request

camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout.name: camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout
camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout.description: How long to block for individual read/write operations (in ms)

camel.component.fhir.summary.description: Request that the server modify the response using the _summary param One of: [COUNT] [TEXT] [DATA] [TRUE] [FALSE]

camel.component.fhir.validationMode.description: When should Camel validate the FHIR Server's conformance statement One of: [NEVER] [ONCE]

camel.component.fhir.password.description: Username to use for basic authentication
